page.title: 04Castletown Week
page.content: Castletown is an area of Penrith that is a very close community, with a great community spirit, that continues throughout the year, but is shared with everybody once a year in July it is called "Castletown Week". This started at the end of the second world war, when Castletown decided to do something to welcome home the soldiers at the end of the war. it was such a sucess that it was decided to carry on until people were not interested, or not enough people came forward to help with the great amount of organising needed. This has not happened and the annnual event is still going strong. There are many different events each day of "the week" which ends on a Saturday with a great 'Gala Day'. Great care is taken, because it is a community that young and old alike are involved and enjoy themselves.
